en: The Best in Heritage Conference 24-26 September
The global annual conference on best practices in cultural heritage…
The Best in Heritage Conference 24-26 September
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)

The Best in Heritage   is an annual survey of award-winning museums and heritage and conservation projects from around the world organised in partnership with Europa Nostra & the Endowment Fund of ICOM, and under patronage of the City of Dubrovnik.

Background

The Best in Heritage is the world's only annual survey of award-winning museums and heritage and conservation projects from around the world.

2015 will see the 14th edition of the conference, organised by the Zagreb-based European Heritage Association, a NGO focusing on cultural heritage, in partnership with Europa Nostra and the Endowment Fund of the International Council of Museums.

The event is supported by the City of Dubrovnik.

Summary

The conference will see the presentation of 28 award winners from around the world, including several laureates of the European Union Prize for Cultural Heritage/Europa Nostra Awards.

Six winners of the EU Prize for Cultural Heritage / Europa Nostra Awards 2014 will present and discuss their outstanding achievements. In the Conservation category, this includes:

  • the Horta Museum in Brussels in Belgium,
  • the Teatro Sociale in Bergamo in Italy,
  • the Historical Route of the Lines of Torres Vedras in Lisbon in Portugal, and
  • Dragomirna Church's 17th Century Frescoes in Suceava in Romania (Grand Prix and Public Choice Award winner).

In the Education category, this includes: 

  • Training and Awareness-Raising, Passage: From a Rusty City to a New Miskolc in Hungary (Grand Prix), and
  • the Coen Case in Hoorn in The Netherlands.

Projects from China, United States, Japan, Iran, Australia, Canada and Russia will also be featured.

The event aims to raise awareness of best practices and provide participants with insights into innovative practices, successful management approaches, and extraordinary professionalism.

The programme is rich in social and cultural content, organised with the help of Dubrovnik Museums which will hold evening tours of its museums, and is held in the Renaissance city centre of Dubrovnik, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

The post-conference seminar "Financing Heritage Institutions in Times of Scarcity", organised in partnership with the Embassy of the Netherlands in Croatia, will take place on 27 September at the Inter-University Centre Dubrovnik.

The EU Prize for Cultural Heritage/ Europa Nostra Awards are the most prestigious recognition in the cultural heritage sector in Europe. The Prize is supported by Creative Europe and implemented in partnership with Europa Nostra.

Programme and registration

Full information on the conference programme is available on the Best in Heritage website.
